subtitleNullable: Recordings and metadata for over 700 of the most critical or unusual 911 calls
descriptionNullable:
Note: This is the complete dataset. For a curated version more suitable for machine learning applications, see https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/louisteitelbaum/911-recordings-first-6-seconds

These 911 logging tapes were collected from public sources by the late Gary Allen, former editor and publisher of Dispatch Monthly magazine and 911 Dispatch website. He describes his collection process as follows: "I have posted these particular recordings because they represent examples of critical or unusual calls, and provide excellent second-hand experience for a public safety dispatcher. In many cases, a 911 call here might be the only time you’ll ever encounter the situation being reported, such as an airline crash."

Recordings (all in mp3 format) and brief text descriptions of each event were retrieved from an Internet Archive capture of the 911 Dispatch website, which is now defunct. Additional metadata (date, state, citizen initiated, deaths, potential death, and false alarm) were manually coded based on the descriptions, recordings, and additional news sources.

Most recordings are of a single, full, uncensored 911 call. However, some begin in the middle, include censored material, or include multiple calls. Some also include brief intros, such as a dispatcher declaring that the recording is legitimate for use in a court case.
title: 911 Recordings
subtitle: Recordings and metadata for over 700 of the most critical or unusual 911 calls
description:
